adjectives.description: dapple (comparative more dapple, superlative most dapple)

entries.meaning: Having a mottled or spotted skin or coat, dappled.
examples: I was on a running Morgan that could leave anything in six counties behind, and all she had was that short-hocked dapple pony.

entries.meaning: A mottled marking, usually in clusters.
An animal with a mottled or spotted skin or coat.
examples: “My brother,” said he, “do not ride to–day / The dapple, as you’re wont; but mount the horse / Which I have chosen for thee.

verbs.description: dapple (third-person singular simple present dapples, present participle dappling, simple past and past participle dappled)

entries.meaning: To mark or become marked with mottling or spots.
